review_title: The DC Covid Response is a mess
job_title: Covid Response in Washington, DC
pros: Working directly with patients was great, I personally enjoyed talking with them to assuage any anxieties they may have and explain the process. And the mid of working on our feet for half the day and sitting down for the other half was nice.
cons: I can't speak to how to rest of the MC clinic is, but the organization of DC Covid team is a wreck. We were perpetually under staffed, under trained, sometimes even yelled at, and after I'd worked there for months my supervisors sometimes still didn't understand basic Covid vaccination protocols (ex. What vaccines can/can't be mixed, what dose people get of each). My coworkers were great and the care we did all we could to still provide quality care, but we all ended up over-worked and after I quit most of my team did as well. Mary's Center is great, but I wouldn't recommend joining the Covid team. While I only worked there for a few months, my former co-workers who are still there have confided in me that it's only gotten worse since I left.

review_title: Mostly good people, mostly poor salaries. Get ready to feel you’re never doing enough.
job_title: Program Coordinator in Washington, DC
pros: Community and sense purpose. Many people are excellent good folks with bleeding hearts for this cause. It’s a good think as you need lots of passion to propel you through this work environment.
cons: Working for a years to progress very little despite excellent performance reviews. If you’re stuck under a supervisor with poor management or people skills there is little to no support. Several times my anonymity was mishandled and shared by HR when it should not have. Management level and above often treated “the rest of us” as a mass blob undeserving of influence. Called entitled for wanting basic accommodations. Would not recommend working here long term. Super high turnover rate. Experienced bias from others based on my age and gender. You will give until you have nothing left to give here and still not May not receive compassion or a raise in return.
